meanings.definition: A person who makes or creates something, especially in a deceitful or dishonest manner.
meanings.sent1: The fabricators of the plan were caught red-handed.
meanings.sent2: The fabricators of the counterfeit money were arrested.
meanings.sent3: The fabricators of the tall tale were not very convincing.
meanings.sent4: The fabricators of the scheme wove a web of lies.
meanings.sent5: The fabricators of the excuse were not very skilled at deception.

meanings.definition: A machine or tool used to create or shape something.
meanings.sent1: The fabricators in the workshop were busy crafting metal parts.
meanings.sent2: The 3D printer is a modern fabricator used in manufacturing.
meanings.sent3: The fabricators in the factory hummed as they worked.
meanings.sent4: The CNC machine is a precise fabricator in the production line.
meanings.sent5: The fabricators in the garage were used for woodworking projects.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or constructing something.
meanings.sent1: The fabricators of the new building worked tirelessly.
meanings.sent2: The artist's studio was filled with various fabricators.
meanings.sent3: The fabricators of the cake were skilled bakers.
meanings.sent4: The fabricators of the bridge faced many challenges.
meanings.sent5: The fabricators of the sculpture used clay as their medium.
